related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
related_issues.text:
"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* Users on M3 Macs are experiencing issues with PiecesOS entering "basic mode" and secret messages not working properly.
* Users are also unable to see updates/rollups of the agent and "Workstream Activity" in the desktop application.
* An "Unknown Origin" element with version 1.0.10 is being displayed in the telemetry browser.

**Problems identified:**

* Bug in PiecesOS causing it to enter "basic mode" on M3 Macs.
* Lack of access to "Workstream Activity" and agent updates in the desktop application.
* Presence of "Unknown Origin" element in telemetry browser.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Restarting PiecesOS will temporarily fix the issue.
* A fix for the "basic mode" bug will be included in the next PiecesOS version.
* Mark will investigate the issue with "Workstream Activity" and agent updates.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The "basic mode" bug will be fixed in the next PiecesOS version.
* The issue with "Workstream Activity" and agent updates is still being investigated.
* Mark will provide an update on the "Unknown Origin" element in the telemetry browser.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)
Also confirmed permissions were granted appropriately:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@kwburgess) is experiencing issues activating Long Term Memory (LTM) in PiecesOS.
* The issue seems to be related to permissions on the user's local machine.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS might not have the necessary permissions to access screen recording, system recording, and accessibility features.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support agent (@mark-at-pieces) asks the user to confirm if PiecesOS has the required permissions.
* If the permissions are not granted, the user is advised to grant them.
* Alternatively, the user can schedule a real-time session with the support agent for further assistance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still open and awaiting the user's response.
* The user needs to confirm the permission status and take appropriate action to resolve the LTM activation issue.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.

**Key Points Raised:**

- Seantiz reported an issue where the copilot stopped responding after 11 requests and didn't load files into the context.
- Seantiz was unable to reproduce the issue on demand.
- Mark suggested switching the LLM to Gemini 2.0 Flash.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with Pieces OS and Desktop app, including installation failures, launch problems, and performance issues. These problems are often related to dependency conflicts, software bugs, and compatibility issues with different operating systems. Solutions involve troubleshooting dependencies, identifying and fixing bugs, and providing workarounds or updates to address compatibility issues.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User installed Pieces OS as a snap on Ubuntu.
* Installing Ollama failed due to `curl` being unavailable in the snap sandbox environment.
* User manually installed Ollama and it worked from the terminal.
* Pieces OS still attempted to install Ollama and failed.

**Problems Identified:**

* Missing `curl` dependency in the snap definition file.
* Pieces OS unable to use Ollama installed outside its sandbox.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add `curl` dependency to the snap definition file.
* Modify Pieces OS to access and use Ollama from outside the sandbox.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Fix is in progress and expected to be released soon.
* User still unable to use Ollama in Pieces OS as of 2025-03-19.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users are waiting for the fix to be released.
* Some users are concerned about not using cloud LLMs and want to use local models instead.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* MoyinShabi is experiencing difficulty connecting **Pieces for Developers** to **Pieces OS**.
* The issue appears to be related to an error in the **Flutter SDK's GetIt package**.
* MoyinShabi provided relevant log files and additional information about the error message.
* mack-at-pieces attempted to reproduce the issue and identified a potential bug in the code.
* A solution involving replacing the existing **com.pieces.pfd** folder with a repaired version was proposed.

**Problems Identified:**

* Inability to connect Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* GetIt package error during launch of Pieces Desktop app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Providing log files and additional information about the error.
* Identifying a potential bug in the code.
* Replacing the existing com.pieces.pfd folder with a repaired version.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The proposed solution did not resolve the issue.
* The issue appears to be related to the GetIt package not finding a particular dependency.
* Further troubleshooting is needed, potentially through a video call.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue appears to be complex and may require further investigation and collaboration between the user and developer.
* The user has been proactive in providing information and attempting solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.

related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Copilot performance issues

**Key points raised:**

* Users reported Copilot performance issues, including slow response times and freezes after using "Hard-Reset Active Runtime."
* High CPU usage and unresponsive behavior were also reported.

**Problems identified:**

* A bug related to "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" prevented websocket re-initialization, causing Copilot to hang.
* The performance of Copilot was impacted in later versions (10.0.3 of OS and 3.0.2 of Desktop app).

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A fix for the hard-reset bug was released in a patch.
* Performance improvements were implemented in version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Most users who updated to the latest versions reported improvements.
* A few users continued to experience lag; further investigation into specific system configurations and potential solutions is needed.

**Additional Notes:**

* The team is available for live chat troubleshooting through a calendar link provided in the conversation.

related_issues.title: Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
related_issues.text:
Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

You can set where new Apps will be installed, new documents are stored, Music, etc.

Once this is set I would expect a current application to follow the default installation setting rather than hardcode it for the Boot drive.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Choosing Installation Location for Pieces OS

**Key Points:**

* User (@bpluly) reported an issue with not being able to choose the installation location for Pieces OS.
* This issue was automatically triaged by the Pieces support bot.

**Problems Identified:**

* Users installing Pieces OS via App Installer (MSIX) package cannot choose the installation location.
* The option to choose the installation location may not be available when installing via Pieces for Developers.
* Currently, users cannot choose the location for their user data.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Use the InnoSetup (EXE) installer to choose the installation location.
* For installations via Pieces for Developers, uninstall and reinstall using the Setup Executable.
* (Future) Feature to allow choosing the location for user data.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user is advised to use the alternative installation method to choose the location.
* The issue of choosing the user data location is acknowledged and planned for a future update.

recommendations: **Prioritize PiecesOS LTM and agent issues:** Allocate additional resources to address the top reported issue cluster, focusing on LTM activation failures and agent problems.

**Investigate Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues:** Conduct thorough testing and debugging to identify the root causes of installation, launch, and performance issues across different operating systems.

**Improve error messaging and user guidance:** Provide clearer error messages and troubleshooting steps for common issues, particularly those related to dependency conflicts and compatibility problems.

**Consider user feedback on installation and data storage:** Explore options to allow users to choose the installation location for Pieces OS and control data storage in future updates.

**Monitor and address performance issues:** Continue to optimize the performance of both the Pieces desktop app and OS, particularly after updates or when using features like "Hard-Reset Active Runtime."

**Proactively identify and address compatibility issues:** Implement a robust testing framework to ensure compatibility with various operating systems, hardware configurations, and third-party software.
**Provide self-service support resources:** Create a comprehensive knowledge base, FAQs, and troubleshooting guides to empower users to resolve common issues independently.
**Offer personalized support options:** Provide multiple support channels, including live chat, email, and video calls, to cater to different user preferences and issue complexities.
